q4NhoN9M9MXimFMWQYwRIA.text: Hungry? Want to leave Edinburgh and go to a hotel for dinner in Kathmandu? in Gurka cafe you will think you have arrived. Quality service, homemade authentic Nepalese food (Italian but better with Chinese Influence).  They guy cant do enough for you. I think next time I go I will ask for a camel steak just to see if they manage to find one! They managed everything else when I took a group of fifteen crazy Americans there.  A credit to your nation and an asset to Edinburgh

GdswzopI21xX3EKtUwf9eQ.text: The food is actually nice and worth my 4-star comment. However the speed they serve foods were really slow. We literally saw this restaurant filled with people but with no food on probably more than half tables. And we waited half an hour for our dishes. If you're a starving backpacker then you shouldn't walk in here. Otherwise worth a try.

S2H_bEfXvtwk5QRg_ZCZsA.text: Excellent and authentic Indian food. We needed a break from UK and Irish cuisine and we got much more. Awesome veggie curry and tikka chicken from the clay pot. Naan is a must too. One drawback English not well spoken

EeLEFRlaDJEIk-DO2gPMng.text: Wonderful Indian Food!  Some of the best we've ever eaten:  papadums, mango lassi, tikka masala, naan.........Excellent!

En1fEbPBZrWE2hhLQrrd8w.text: Epic food with curry. It's a combination of Thai and India. Curry was mostly very mild and not so spicy. A bit expensive probably because of the location, compared to other restaurants that serves curry in Edinburgh.

3CORL4K0aWFOLUjRLn7Diw.text: Delicious food. Cute atmosphere with awesome decor inside. Service slightly slow but defiantly go for some yummy authentic Indian/Nepalese

L4ijRBK1eEf_RHbCkNtHDg.text: Absolutely delicious, everything was perfect! great value for the money. Lovely service. Bestbutterchicken we've ever had!

fxuBVlY73VQRi0G0zE48Dw.text: A friend and I grabbed dinner here on a beautiful night in Edinburgh.  We ordered a chicken appetizer which we thought was slightly bland, so we asked them to turn up the heat on our entrees. And they definitely turned it up! The Chicken Biryani and Madras Chicken were delicious and we had enough for leftovers as well.  They are not exactly cheap, but hey, we got two meals out of it, so I guess it's okay.

FkB0GqOjkC8Gl3k7ei7Iqg.text: We started with chicken momo. They were good, a bit like a curried ravioli. The sauce tasted a bit like a spicy tomato pasta sauce, making it seem even more like a twisted Italian dish. They were good, none the less. I got my bhuteko khasi (lamb) as hot, and it was a bit spicy but not nearly what I expected. The taste was great for this dish.  We also had the rasilo chicken which, at medium spice, was not hot at all. I preferred my lamb.

T2STDRd0Pd4hthUZShq4Mg.text: This is a True little gem.  I am perhaps the world's greatest critics of Indian / Nepalese restaurants as I know what I like and they often don't live up to my standards.  I've got my favourite restaurants that I frequent and I do often try others but 99% of the time I leave disappointed.    I'm very happy to say that when I went to The Gurkha Cafe this was the other 1%.  I was anything but disappointed!!!    The interior of this place is really cool, it feels like you're in a little hut as it has open wooden beams all over the ceiling.  I felt as thought I'd taken a plane east by just stepping through the door.  The interior really does set the tone and makes a lovely change from other restaurants in Edinburgh.    I saw someone at the table next to me drinking a Nepalese Gurkha beer so I decided when in Rome...  It was not a bad beer and went well with the food but for 4.95 for 660mls it wasn't so cheap.  Worth it for the label though.    I went for the Mo Mo Cha Nepalese chicken dumplings to start and you could choose this either steamed or fried.  I went for steamed and was SO glad that I did as they were delicious.  I was a bit apprehensive but they were very tasty.  They were crescent moon shaped and there were lots of them - I'm sure I had at least 5 and was full after the starter alone as they certainly didn't scrimp on the portion sizes!  What made this dish though was the sauce that accompanied it.  I couldn't work out what was in it and it didn't say on the menu but this was a tasty little number.  I want to say it was mustard as that's what it looked like but I hate the stuff so know it certainly wasn't that.  No matter what was in it, it was divine and just pushed this dish over the edge and into the exquisite category.    My companion had the chicken satay to start with.  This wasn't the usual Asian chicken satay that you'd normally expect as this was with a Nepalese twist.  The size of this dish could have easily passed for a main course!  There were huge chunks of chicken under a rich, tomato / barbeque style sauce.  As I said, not like the usual peanut style satay but still good.  Not as good as my dumplings though - top tip!!!  :)  Another good thing about this place (to add to the huge list) is you can specify how mild or how hot you'd like your meal to be so the dishes really are made to your specific requirements.    For main course I ordered the chicken korma.  When ordering in fact, I asked the waiter what he recommended by telling him what I liked.  I know a lot of people think, 'boring old korma' but this restaurant gave this dish a new lease of life.  The tastes and flavours in this dish were phenomenal.  That's what I love about Nepalese even more than Indian restaurants, they use even more herbs and spices to create the perfect flavours.  Yummy!!!  Again the portion sizes were very generous but it was so tasty that I couldn't stop eating until I'd finished it all.    My fellow diner had the chicken garlic and chilli if I remember correctly.  It came out still cooking on a hot plate and the colours of the dish made for great presentation.  The quantity as well as quality of this dish was unbelievable, we could have easily shared this alone without starters and still left full I'm sure.  She only managed a quarter of it as it was!  As I said above, although this dish is made with chilli she asked for it to be mild and it suited her just perfectly.    We ordered rice and a peshwari nan to go with the main courses.  The nan was lovely, lighter than most nans which was a good thing considering the amount of food and it came in a basket cut into pizza style slices.    This place really does have it all - you can't get a more central location, the highest of quality food with flavours bursting in every mouthful, good friendly service and a different yet cool interior.  It's a winner!!!    As if you can't tell already, I love this place.  Take whatever I've written and imagine I love it 100% more then you'll be getting a bit closer to understanding how much I enjoyed this meal and now love this restaurant.  Honestly, the only thing left to say is try it for yourself.  I'm sure you won't be disappointed and if you are then you can always take the left overs away for me:)

DtxAbq9ewG32MRw2vjRmvg.text: Great place. The food was amazing, the service was friendly and the atmos was nice and cozy.

nqfWHVnjMpGlsmmjPVytYA.text: Best Indian Nepalese food I've ever had in Scotland, hands down! In all seriousness, the food was incredible, the portions were generous, and the service was great. I highly recommend the Aloo Kauli, it was amazing!

mtlICgke-F507abxrit0-Q.text: Yep! All of the reviews are spot on. This ranks as one of the best curries I've ever had. Try the Nepalese beer too.

p8Jf1LkvhPIxWV2iFjiKqA.text: Horrible customer service! We read the good reviews and went over for dinner. After a 15mins wait, someone came to check on us to see if we have a reservation. We said we didn't and she told us to wait and came back to check on the person who came after us. She went back in to check on the table for him and came back and told him to wait 10mins for the table. When I asked for the wait for me, she said it would be hour and half. I don't get how the person behind me without reservation gets a table in 10 mins but I have to wait for 1&1/2. Seems messed up!

JxIuwY5ExM2O5f_-HF0Cbw.text: This was a very solid Indian restaurant. I was able to find a dairy free curry that was delicious. My daughter had chicken Tikka and said it was great.  Good find for those US people who are hooked on the Far East spices.

gZyAyUSB62PFUqApejXYqg.text: Yum yum yes! Got chicken tikka Marsala which is always a good bet but this one exceeded expectations. As did the ambiance and speed. Would recommend splitting dishes!

e5eRpSIY3ufzDnK_vnscfg.text: This place has a combination of awesome food, great service, rustic decor & a very cozy ambience! We visited this restaurant twice in one day (lunch & dinner). The mo-mo's with the red sauce is a must try!! They even offered free beer (Gurkha beer) while we waited for food!

2BUyV0AqHWhoFjcWOWN-hg.text: Zoe and I have been searching for a really good Indian restaurant in Edinburgh, and I think we have finally found it.   The Gurkha Cafe serves Indian and Nepalese food, and is a cosy little restaurant just off the Royal Mile. The interior is like a brightly coloured Swiss chalet, with low exposed wooden logs, contrasting with bright painted walls.  To start, I ordered the interestingly names MoMo Cha, spiced chicken dumplings that can be ordered either fried, or steamed, and I opted for fried. Zoe had the Tandoori Chicken. My MoMo Cha came with a sort of curry mayonnaise dip, which was perfect for the crisp, crunchy little pastry packets of spicy chicken inside. These were plenty spicy, and offered a very interesting alternative to the usual Indian starters. I will definitely try them steamed next to to see how the texture compares.   Zoe's Tandoori Chicken was served with a trio of dips, tamarind, chili, and spicy coriander. The chicken was melt-in-the-mouth, and was perfectly spiced. This was a perfect example of how to do Tandoori, and it was a very generous helping too!  For mains, I had the Bhuteko Khasi, described on the menu as tender lamb cooked with green chili, garlic and spring onion in thick sauce; Zoe opted for Pudini Chicken: chicken marinated in mint cooked with herbs spices and green peppers. The lamb was incredibly tender, and had clearly been slow cooked long enough for the meat to break down nicely. The sauce was thick and rich, and plenty of spice to satisfy my craving for heat.  Zoe's chicken was also beautifully succulent, and was unlike any curry either of us have ever tasted because of the strong mint flavour, which was incredibly refreshing for a curry! We shared a garlic Naan and pilau rice.  The naan was perfectly cooked, and super tasty with loads of garlicky flavour, and was nice and crisp underneath. The rice was nice too.  The portions here are so generous, two people could probably share a main, unless you are super hungry.  I would say two curries between three people would be the perfect amount. The waiter was very friendly and informative about the menu, and we felt very welcome.  There's no doubt the standard of food here is high, and we will certainly be going again soon. Highly recommended, and a very welcome addition to the curry scene in Edinburgh.

Gll1DHKMt9wXxp8DB0NHVQ.text: My boyfriend was especially excited about this place as he just got back from a photo trek in Nepal, and it certainly did not disappoint. The service was warm and welcoming and the food was very, very good. We came back here a couple times during our time in Edinburgh, and we wished we could pack it up and take it home with us.

07gsD7vlt_yrCPM0lXaucg.text: The staff were great and didn't push too hard in that way that Indian restaurants sometimes do to get you to buy more food. I found the lamb Achari not spicy enough, even at hot level. The vegetable korma was a tad sweet, but all overall good.   They're great for large late parties, even ones with an extra 4 people who unexpectedly turned u 35 after the rest

d2yIq66sCUkQefayZ0egbg.text: Appears authentic and the food is delicious and so much per serving that not all food was finished :-(. Very busy but food keeps you occupied.

QWajrR1ntxieFJtuM4VFpg.text: All too often I find myself in a predicament. If I am to wander into a coffee shop and catch sight of carrot cake on the counter then I simply can't have anything but carrot cake. This is both a wonderful and terrible affliction; all other delightful options are off the table but, of course, I am presented with one of my most favourite things in the world. And so, naturally, I judge a cafe on the quality of it's finest slice. If you can serve me up some delectable carrot cake, you have my affections.  The korma, for me, is the carrot cake of Indian cuisine; whilst I'll have a browse of the menu, tell myself that today will be the day for a new dish and even deliberate over various mouth-watering options, my decision is already made and I am no less satisfied with a plateful of creamy korma curry goodness. So when my friend chose Gurkha for her birthday dinner, you can bet there was just one dish on my mind.  A table of 18 is quite the feat for any restaurant and Gurkha's service was exceptional from start to finish. We were difficult; unsure of when the rest of the guests would arrive and when it it came to ordering, there was constant changing of orders, and the number of side portions of rice and naan was forever fluctuating. Basically, we were a restaurant's nightmare but the Gurhka staff couldn't have been more professional. It was a wonder that they got our orders completely right considering how chaotic we were, but the staff were attentive and this really showed.  If you can resist the Indian delight that is the mango lassi, then I commend you. I ordered one and was presented with a wonderfully scrumptious glass of thick mango yoghurt heaven. Saving some for the meal was impossible and I slurped it down in an instant. It;s safe to say that the Gurkha has perfected the mango lassi and I want another and another and another. The korma...Well, that was a heaven-sent bowl of creamy warming goodness and I could have licked the plate clean. With deliciously tender-cooked chicken, accompanied with rice and full-of-flavour garlic naan, it made for quite the Indian feast.  I now know where to go in Edinburgh when craving authentic Indian and Nepalese food. And of course; incredible Korma.

3auIcCXbyJWNT21iYvZU-A.text: I wish we had found this place earlier in our trip instead of the last night we were in town.  The place is busy (make a reservation!) and it takes a bit of time to get your waiter's attention as well as your food served, but the dishes are worth the wait.  The wait staff could use a bit more training or care a bit more about their job.  We sat next to a table where a German couple had just finished their food and the waiter asked if they wanted dessert.  When they asked what was available the waiter stared at them like they had 3 heads--and 3 feet away from us were a slew of dessert menus that he didn't even bother to bring to them.  Very odd service.  If you can get over the indifference of the wait staff the food is worth it.

lrWwC7BQ2Gz-ZKhQcYrOOw.text: This was so yummy! Great to have a mix of Nepali and Indian dishes. The papadums were a recommended started for the table. Yummy mango lassi, and super soft tasty tandoori fish tikka. Portion not very big with this one but perfect accompanied with some naan or (yummy coconut pineapple) rice. It was quite busy so luckily we could make a reservation for us 6. the only downside is that we had to ask 3 times for water for the table but I am pretty sure that was just bad luck as the waiters were generally very nice and accommodating. Will go back for sure, recommended!

yqySi3wj01-5deP1xd3ktQ.text: Just got back from a trip to Europe and doing reviews of some of the places we ate. Had the butter chicken, poleko bhale kukhura, saag panneer and some papadums / rice / garlic naan. Everything was good but I've had better Indian food locally. One thing I did notice was the butter chicken had a unique flavor that tasted like it had a bit of whiskey in it (or some other local spice maybe?). Since we were in Scotland it could have easily been whiskey :) The only other note would be that service was rather slow.

awnCmbr3699Itf1RWNLNoQ.text: So AWESOME! You must try it! We had the garlic naan with the tandoori chicken and the tikka masala. They were all great! Loved every second of it.

YR1zuUYNX-Tix-N3g-V_iA.text: Nice ambience, tasty food and good service. Just keep in mind that the Yelp check-in coupon doesn't work during the Fringe festival month

KW4udg5bMO12kIC7Pze9yQ.text: First off didn't expect a great Indian food place in Edinburgh so were skeptical of what to expect. This turned out to be a great place.   First off the decor is very homely, rustic and comfortable. Food menu is good and most of the food served - veg as well as non veg is very well made. I assess quality of any restaurant with the type of Nan/Roti they serve and this one had some of the best ones. Fresh and tasty to eat.   The food quantity was sufficient and had the right spices.   The only reason they almost lost the fifth star was time of service as they are pretty slow. The explanation provided to me was that they start cooking the food after one orders. I will give them that given the tasty food they served.   Good going.

iooWW_HjFvWveUdr_6lK6Q.text: Another testament to the power of Yelp was in our trip to Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant. Looking for a place to eat a hearty curry or similar in a certain area of Edinburgh, we took to the app to find this place near the top with many favourable reviews - and I can see why. We absolutely loved our meal here, and will be back should we find ourselves hungry for Nepalese or Indian in Edinburgh again!  I looked at available tables on the app, but found they weren't taking reservations for any earlier than 2 hours time. Starving, but desperate to try this great-sounding place, we decided to head there anyway and see if they could squeeze us in. We weren't a terribly long walk from Cockburn Street, which is a great location for such a restaurant - and we managed to just beat the rush for an early dinner. We had bright surroundings, almost terracotta walls and various (Nepalese tourist board approved!) pictures hung depicting scenes from Nepal and beyond. The panpipes and other calming music, coupled with the bright setting, made a welcome change to the often bland curry houses you can find up and down the country.  Friendly waiting staff quickly supplied us with the necessary appetisers; popadoms, naturally, with a pickle selection. There was a garlicky, tomatoey, almost salsa-esque dip which was just divine; I could have eaten it all day! But I had by this point ordered a delicious sounding Nepalese-style lamb curry. I cannot remember the name (bottom left of the menu!) but it promised tender meat, chilli, garlic, and "Nepalese spices" - whatever they might be. I don't much mind what they were, really, because it was absolutely delicious. One of the best curries I've ever had in my life, it was full of flavour, with every piece of garlic and chilli adding to a buttery richness in my very happy mouth. I ate the lot (rare for such a large dish!) and mopped up the sauce with my huge, fresh naan.  We were way too stuffed and happy to contemplate dessert, but I'm sure they would have been just as good. Great value too, as with beer and mains (plus popadoms of course) we only paid around 50 for the two of us.   Worth every penny, and then some!

DkzSAkl8GShMq2bTR9dWeA.text: Came here on Yelp's recommendation and we were not disappointed. We had the mix-started with a variety of pakora, lamb and salad. Everything spiced and balanced perfectly. For our entree's, we shared the Butter Chicken and Saag Paneer along with rice and naan. Everything was absolutely outstanding - among the best I've had!

z6-oxi1y4zDlSFkDJMjguA.text: The food here is terrific. Had dinner on 5/24 at approx 5:30p. Folks kept coming in so arrive early or make a reservation. Had saag with lamb--outstanding. Spouse had seekh kabob--rolled pieces of lamb--outstanding. Had a lentils dish--outstanding. Dishes were very flavorful.  Staff was attentive. A definite find.

KYCE5LIFdmtZjdKA-yKsXw.text: Fantastic food. The paneer makani and tandoori chicken were the best I've ever had! Thanks for having us. We will be back next time we are in Edinburgh!

ZUFJmyKAYlKxWgufrowRnQ.text: This was the best meal we had in Edinburgh. Phenomenal food with amazing flavors. We shared a sample appetizer and chicken korma, king prawn madras and chicken tikka that were amazing! Lovely wonderful evening.

4bOzB4V1vQkdCybgIHb81Q.text: We ate here last night because of yelp recommendations for my friends birthday, and we were not disappointed!  The vegetarian options for myself were interesting, with different takes on Nepalese and Indian staples. I've spent 3 months in Nepal and tasted all the wonderful curries out there, so I was even more impressed to find these curries not only compared to the real thing but some were even better! I tried the dishes of everyone around me and wow the flavours were perfection and they even tweaked my dal, making it even spicer for me and I can honestly say it is the best dal curry I have ever tasted!  The mango lassi was bang on, perfect with a hot curry, and the karma sutra drink was dangerously yummy.  I had popped into the restaurant earlier in the day with a cake and candles for our friend, at the end of our meal the staff dimmed the lights, put on a birthday song and even made a lovely display saying "Happy Birthday Suzie" on the plate carrying the cake and out the candles on exactly as I had asked.  I really can't rate the food, drinks and staff at Gurkha highly enough, I'll definitely be returning next time I'm in Edinburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

CcQ7YnZo4a-71vxHK99Rxg.text: if I could give more stars I would ! If you are in Edinburgh and enjoy Indian food, you need to eat here! Fabulous friendly staff, beautiful decor, and the food is top notch. The dumplings are a must to start, the nan - steaming hot and fresh. Tandoori chicken - moist, juicy and super tasty. The lamb dish also was melt in your mouth delicious ...... sorry to be leaving Edinburgh tomorrow - I would be a regular customer here if I could !

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. chicken dumplings

5NWSNhnd9llX3GybYa9sbA.text: I was led to this restaurant based on the great yelp reviews. The food was very good, not traditional regional cuisine but never the less fine presentation and quantity.  The service  was however quite poor.  There are actually no pickles in the pickle dish, when asked for some they did respond but it took way too long, my popodums were already history. The garlic nan bread was freshly cooked looked great but was under cooked leaving a dooey center.  When I ordered a beer it took a long time to come so I went to the bar and asked what was up. It turned out they were changing the barrel. No problem I said I'll take a bottled beer instead so I can have it with my meal ( or what was left of it).  This created chaos. Oh no you must have your ordered beer....will it come in time before I finish my meal?.....they exchanged it for a bottle of tiger (no apology).  But the food was good so 3 stars.

8o8iILJCSOMmsg9K5nrcKA.text: Came here thanks to the yelp reviews and had the best meal out of our whole week in Scotland! We ordered the Tandoori Chicken and the Chicken Korma, with rice and garlic naan. Both meals were delicious! The food took a little long to make it out, but once it was served it was obvious as to why. Perfection. The chef also came out and greeted us to make sure the food was alright. You won't go wrong here. Plus the 15% off check-in deal before 5pm is a nice bonus!

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tandoori chicken closest and Chicken Korma across.

BPQgdLdqB_4wy939NLKerA.text: Great food value; wonderful dining.  Enjoyed dinner here recently and recommend same to travelers.  I had the Bhuteko Khasi (lamb); 'medium'  - -and the restaurant is willing to adjust spice content to individual tastes.

OzGHwgu433XafDdzO9ykFg.text: My wife and I had dinner there this evening and it was terrific. The staff was attentive and suggested several dishes to pair with our entrees.  They made sure to inquire about how hot we liked our food (we both love spicy foods!) and the resulting dishes were excellent.  We enjoyed two different spicy chicken entrees and were pleased to confirm they were actually very different and not just slight variations on the same dish.  The garlic naan was excellent as well.  Service was well paced but not at all rushed.  Very easy for us to recommend!

JoC7sUW_5LbK0-TekPrvJw.text: Stopped in as we smelled the most delightful spice emanating from the doorway.  We ordered starters and vegetarian mains and I was quite impressed with the quality of the meal.  The service was attentive.  Nothing to disappoint here.

diPjV4AUp3uALZYMAyzE0A.text: Finally a restaurant in Edinburgh that lived up to it's yelp ratings. Very good Indian food. We ordered chicken tikka as starter. Very well spiced and succulent pieces perfectly grilled chicken. The accompanying chutneys were just the right amount spice and tanginess. For the main course we ordered dal makhani, paneer kadhai, garlic naan, and mix veg rice.   First the naan, perfectly baked with just the right amount of garlic to lightly flavor and not overpower you. Lightly buttered just what was expected.   Paneer kadhai was very we cooked, nice spices. Only caution is that it was made with a lot of oil. I may not order it again just for that reason.   Dal makhani, what shall I say, it was perfect, just I remember from restaurants in Delhi, very authentic. Just amazing.   Ve rice, had a good combination of vegetables and lightly spiced with cumin and thyme. The flavor just took me back home to my mothers cooking!  To top all of this, the service was excellent. One of my gripes with Indian restaurants is that they do not give finger bowls outside India. They gave wet towels, wonder why other Indian restaurants don't do this. Simple but effective.   Full hearted recommendation for Indian food in Edinburgh to Gurkha!

BYToSpGsRpqKDWmhK0IolA.text: First and foremost the restaurant is set in a cozy street called Cockburn a 5 min walk from princess street, old town. It has low hit like ceiling with wooden beams and planks. So it does have that old world appeal. The service is kinda quick and it's a little noises in there, but I like that. Cuz quiet places are simply awkward. It's a very social place.   For starters we ordered Chicken momo which were nice but seemed like they were steamed and sat around for 5 mins too long. The chicken could've been softer but overall definitely recommended.   King Prawns for a starter are an absolute let down. Because it's one of the most expensive starters. It costs 8 pounds sterling, that's British pounds ladies; and that's over $$$$10 of those almighty United States Dollars. Just imagine you can buy a dress or eat this appetizer? :D I did ask them and they said its at their competitors in town are doing. But for me any business or establishment has to set itself apart by doing things differently and not repeating the same stuff.   Now that we have opened a can of worms, let's get to the guts, the meat of the critique. If you're ordering a meat dish then you expect a lot more than a couple of cubes of meat. We had a lamb, which was finger licking good. But the lamb vs sauce, I think we know that the sauce won that fight. It was way more sauce than you'd like, especially cuz you wanna taste the texture of the meat. Instead of being overpowered by the flavors of the sauce. It was still delicious and FRESH though. That's the most important thing. The paneer saag was wonderful and held its own next to the lamb & and tandoori chicken was moist and soft and came with a bit of sauce. We also got a cucumber raita that helped cool things down. And a salad which was nice next to high powered he at creamy curries. And with very soft delicious garlic naan bread & vegetable rice to mix in afterwards, it was an overall pretty perfect meal.   But yeah stay away from ordering king prawn, def not worth the money! This was a 5 star review, but the king prawn simply isn't a good deal. Consumers wanna eat well whilst being smart about their purchase cuz that's an added feel good bonus. It's only 8 pounds but Indian and you know we invented the copper wire fighting over pennies. But then again I'm from the rich agricultural state of Punjab and we have the richest food. And when we make a lamb, and the lamb runs out before the sauce. It's considered an embarrassment. So that's Punjab 5 & Nepal 4 hehe!

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Forgot to use this. Not even sure if it was gonna work lol
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. King prawn: overpriced, way too small of a portion and the suave way too spicy. Not recommended simply cuz of portions and price.
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. What a feast!! Amazing fresh food!

nR_ZN_laaUIC9QBOIebA8Q.text: What a wonderful find-one block from High Street is a small restaurant with both Indian and Nepalese food. Loved the Momo's. The relish plate was flavorful. But as wonderful as the food is, the service was even better.  Sujan gave us great recommendations for food and beer, napkin folding lessons and, when we asked about spicy sauce, had a whole pot of hot sauce with spicy pickle made up for us. Nabin was also very pleasant.

sjj3241dmA98Bk7dox_pRg.text: Amazing food . Staff are very attentive and pleasant. The couple next to me had small kids- the waiter - Gautaum went on to make them feel at home.   I ordered the chicken special- the Chicken was succulent and daal makhani was very Tammy as was the naan. The wine was okay One word delicious ! After a walking tour this was perfect comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

4r23kwMahN5nxZpaPgr2Uw.text: Great food. Nice atmosphere. Only reason it's not a 5 is the staff were somewhat rude and inattentive.   Would probably return in the future and hope for a better waiter.

nu4a4JMysoG_OYSDCRsYoQ.text: Nepal restaurant family owned and operated in Edinburgh. Food was on point, prices were reasonable and the manager and head chef checked to make sure the food/service was good. Could not recommend enough, 5-stars

n1DqIrApwXIHO8jyfQ-IjA.text: I had the Madras curry with chicken. I told them to make it extra spicy. It came back good. Not too spicy but spicy enough. I The naan was good also. Worth checking out if your inthe hood and want some indian.

nuZ6CHBh1fUcETRdpxO7TQ.text: Great wholesome food. Great service. Would def recommend for good indo Nepalese food. Ordered the paneer makhani and mushroom pyaza, both well made and tasted awesome.

dUXEaFIxH2ZzY7ibrwBUzw.text: Unexpected really awesome food! We got to meet the chef and the waiter was really friendly. The curries here were really decent.

0Hpd6ywyHjRzT7rWwEjxZw.text: This Indian on Cockburn street was some of the best I've ever had. The Paneer was awesome. Everything was so fresh. Would definitely recommend.

XBG-VHl0n6rQEGXA26v0NQ.text: Delicious food and great service! We loved the saag paneer, butter chicken, garlic naan, lamb kebabs, and raita. We went back the next day for a snack because it was so good! It gets busy in the evenings.

wSpulj7zMcLko9C0M9CTlg.text: The food quality was superb, and the portions were big as well. I ordered the chicken curry, rice, and garlic nun; and I could barely finish everything, that says a lot, since I'm a generous eater. I wish I was staying longer in Edinburgh so I could try some of their other dishes. I really enjoyed the decor, and the soft music.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. So yummy

XMwZdGi9GJFKJj5Luvm_GQ.text: One of the best Indian meals I've had in a very long time. The Madras was spicy (enough to make me sweat), and amazingly flavorful. Service was excellent and the decor and ambience were wonderful.

-o3iiw_qE_3n2C0rYnkeHw.text: One of the best Indian restaurants I've eaten at. The service was quite slow, however. Recommend making a reservation.

TnelbIlRxcqluL6mUo-lPA.text: Very good food. Fast and friendly staff. Did not rush us but were there when we needed and wanted them. Chicken tikka masala and korma were tasty. They made them extra spicy to my specifications.

G3eLzwrwQuX1Wb49Cyv3jQ.text: Delicious.   Gurkha Cafe was a nice breath of fresh air amongst the usual mess of Indian eateries. With a Nepalese/Indian blend of offerings, well-designed decor, impeccable service and gorgeous food, it's got something great going for it. The portion sizes were really generous and every single thing was delicious. This is definitely a keeper of a place on my Edinburgh restaurant list. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. So delicious!

rwz3ZjIeelI2YEvTm5gjRA.text: Here in Edinburgh on vacation and enjoying the local fare, we decided to try Gurkha to get something with more spice. We weren't disappointed. Had a few starters which were very nice. The entrees were Lamb Khutta and Tandoori Chicken. Both were wonderful! The lamb was spicy and the serving was very generous. Service was very good as well. Highly recommend this restaurant.

XMkwzMdl6NRkI02Fh_zp1Q.text: Awesome restaurant! Great place for an authentic experience. Awesome veg options!! Good beers and a very good value! I recomend this to anyone who loves Indian food and also for anyone who has never experienced the flavors of Nepal and India. Waitress was beatiful and kind as well :) I forgot the name of my app but it was #6, for my main I got the Veg Korma w rice and the naan. It was the best I've ever had! All in all I had 2 tall beers, an app and a main w 2 sides and it only cost me 30. Great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Veg Korma w rice and naan. Tastiest I&#39;ve ever had!
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. App #6. Super tasty. Prawns and veg, lil spicey, not intense. Delicious!!

_x_0D4dKQv0p8fbmvtpRXw.text: Excellent. Probably my second favourite Scottish meal (first being a dreamy fish bar in a magical town called Luss). Gurkha was a solid meal choice during a rainy Fringe night. There is a Yelp check in discount (15% off your bill), but this is just a bonus. You would likely be happy & satisfied with any of the delicious Nepalese/Indian dishes regardless of any discounts.

MPC20gc7BJus_u5_sG2VSg.text: Did not expect such great Indian food in Edinburgh! We'd noticed that curry was popular here, and wanted to see it was authentic. Saw some overpriced restaurants on yelp with bad reviews and chose this place because it seemed to be the most reasonable of the nearby Indian places. Very pleasantly surprised with the food, and would definitely recommend it. The Paneer Karahi is particularly good. Totally hit the spot!

gCr0TIrZHui-nCRkmP5T8w.text: Pappadums to start were good but the chicken tikka masala was really too sweet. Husband's lamb curry was better, but the flavor difference was so stark it was hard to eat one after the other. Three stars for solid, average Indian food.  No wait for a table when we went on a weekday evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken Tikka Masala (left) and lamb curry

OAR3novsNK6NNX08Ct58_Q.text: If curry is the staple of Londoners, the Scots must set the bar high too  I was not expecting to be curried out in Edinburgh, but dinner at Gurkha was quite possibly my culinary highlight of a recent U.K. Trip! Best Indian food in a really long time ..the potato cauliflower and the paneer hit the spot ...right temperature,spice, flavor and portions - mouthwatering (even the thought of it over a month later!) - JKR or RLS could wax eloquent if they liked Himalayan food :) Wonderful little place in town - must visit!!

b-QXpaFVhRyHnvrXttezAg.text: This is one of my favorite Indian meals. Came here while visiting Edinburgh after finding it on Yelp. The Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Madras were oh so flavorful with the perfect kick of spice. Great meal to warm us up after a long day of sightseeing!  Would definitely recommend!

Jdj2ry85DIiBiAXBZ1tSvg.text: The food is good. I was here tonight and there was a large group that the waiters attending to left us waiting a long time for food, They also moved us to another table so they could accommodate other guests. If The staff can't operate smoothly with large groups; they need to either have more staff or train them efficiently.

QKAS9YeeMSpdRhlqCohbOA.text: Delicious! Spicy and flavorful! Great location. Great atmosphere. Service was a little slow but that was similar to True Indian culture and we weren't in a hurry so it was totally fine. If you're ready to relax and have some great food, check this place out. They even made it super spicy for us!

ImpO4lVlOYXGWlC9oDXfDw.text: We had dinner at the Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant because of the reviews it had on yelp. We weren't disappointed! We were visiting Edinburgh for a few days from SW London and had dinner with our two children 8 and 10. The staff were charming and attentive and the food was fantastic.  Popadoms were fresh and crunchy, chutneys delicious and the curries perfect. We had a lamb curry, two chicken curries and one veg curry and rice and naan. The bread was perfectly fresh and the meats were perfectly tender.  There was plenty of food. Too much for us really.  I would recommend this place to any curry fan. From outside you'd never know it's size inside. Don't be put off!

ydEMgIN1bM3oC72X40_ZHQ.text: Absolutely extraordinary! Just off the Royal Mile yet not crowded! The venue was sedate and service was attentive and prompt. Menu is a combination of Nepalese and Indian, all clearly marked and they are happy to adjust spice level.  The quality of the lamb was remarkable! Better by far than Australian, and would give Colorado a run for its money! Chicken was also incredibly flavorful and moist. Definitely not Purdue or commercial.   The spices and combination were unique! Chicken with lentils (Nepalese) and Lamb with spinach are not to be missed and definitely get the cucumber yogurt to go along with the bread.  Prices are reasonable

BGRepx8dciCRGViyTjOuTw.text: Great restaurant. Wonderful food. Excellent staff.  I've been eating at this restaurant semi-regularly for several years now. I recommend this place to all of my coworkers and Edinburgh visitors. Besides the wonderful Indian standard dishes they also offer several Nepalese choices.  My favorites appetizers: Momo dumplings (a standard Nepali street food, I'm told).  Lamb Choila (fresh and spicy with a variety of flavors and textures). Nepalese Achar (Potato salad also fresh and spicy).  You must try them all!  The main dishes I regularly order are Lamb Madras and Lamb Khutta. Both are superb and of course the spice level can be adjusted to your liking on all of the dishes. I have tried many of the other dishes, but these are my favorites. I've heard many people enjoying the butter chicken, tandoori chicken and biryanis.  I always leave feeling satisfied, and looking forward to my next visit. I love this place.

deK7HSWIOfjDmq1bg5J80A.text: The food is good and for us it has to be spicy. My wife ordered vindaloo off the menu and had it extremely spicy which was good for us. The next table complained of medium butter chicken too spicy. Overall was pretty good.

gGCXG5jcGYk_1Eel1MlI9A.text: The menu has traditional Indian plus Nepalese cuisine. Service was prompt and friendly. We started with starters 6&7. They were both excellent. The mixed sampler had perfect flavor a and not greasy at all. The piro jinga machha (shrimp) one was sweet and spicy.  For lunch we both had lamb dishes which were also perfectly executed. Mine was a rice dish (biryani) and served with a sauce. His was a lamb Khutta (shank), and it was what dreams are made of! Both of the naan dishes were tasty too!

cr_bRN6XK1W-T3FjJQMjZw.text: Wonderful restaurant close to the Royal Mile. Comfortable seating, great atmosphere- and the food was excellent! Staff is extremely nice.

y2vsKQ0F3jjVCB4vYNcPJA.text: I came to this restaurant after a long day of travel. I was tired, my Airbnb key wasn't working, and I was so hungry for serious flavor after a week of meat & potatoes in England. Though I was a bit frenetic after my long day, they very graciously helped me through the menu to get the perfect meal. The food was ready in less than 10 minutes. It's warmth & flavor was so comforting after such a tough day. So grateful for this restaurant, it's staff, and it's delicious food!

YkpFS2Kj_Ngva71tmI6wng.text: We were seated right away on a busy Sunday night. Every table in the restaurant was full. We ordered and were served our water right away.   The waitstaff is very friendly and polite.   It took over 20 minutes for our one appetizer to come to the table. It took another 10 minutes for our entrees to arrive. The food was really good but slow to come to the table.

hYPFh_c6t3NcNEltKPWsJA.text: Make sure you reserve a table beforehand! It was packed, and loads of walk-ins had to be turned away. We got extremely lucky and promised to eat in under 45 minutes, so were able to to nab a table.   The food was really good and portions were decently large. Definitely go for the garlic naan which is packed with amazing flavor. We also ordered a prawn biryani that came with a lovely sauce and chicken korma curry. The food was great, and the service was friendly.

o9h7p8wQtMu6aDagVAX2FA.text: FOOD 4// SERVICE 3//AMBIANCE 4  Cozy restaurant with flavorful Indian and Nepali food. Perfect mix between fine and casual dining -- the food is good but definitely does not taste home cooked.. It is more fine dining oriented. We ordered the butter chicken, normal naan, garlic naan , khadhahi paneer,chai, gulab jamun and ghajar ka halva (carrot halva). The butter chicken was flavorful and you could taste the cardamom !! Everything was very good. The Gulab jamun was exceptionally good and one of the best I have had. There was ice cream on the gulab jamun which I was not a fan of.. But it was so good without the ice cream!!   Recommend this for a great dining experience in regards to food!Service was good but a bit slow and nothing too memorable.

JZiAWwduEEwJCOtA64w9SQ.text: BEST NEPALESE FOOD OUT THERE. If you aren't familiar with the food - no problem. Ask for the waiter Karki ("car-key") and he'll get you exactly what you want. This place is so friendly and welcoming and definitely a place to go when you visit Edinburgh. Highly recommend !!!!

fBizg-eBrA6o_z7Hflfftw.text: I've been to the Gurkha a few times. The food has always been great and flavoursome.   It's quite a tight squeeze to sit in as the location makes it popular.   I've always enjoyed it however more recently the waitresses faces could sink a ship and I think waiting 45 minutes between starter and main meal is unacceptable. This has only happened once yet it wasn't that busy, felt like we were being judged.   I'll be back and the tips will reflect the service.

bxrFao0TNUjQWqP3etI45w.text: I dined here two days in a row when I came to Edinburgh. The waiter, the guy who usually serves the front (no hat and who says "yeah" many times), was super kind and attentive. I ordered biryani 2 days in a row because it was THAT good. It may be a bit expensive to dine here but it was worth the money.  Note to management: DON'T CHOP A HUNDRED ONIONS DOWNSTAIRS NEAR THE BATHROOM WHEN THERE IS A FULL HOUSE! Diners, myself included, had very irritated eyes and it ruined the experience a bit. One girl was even crying. So, I would appreciate it if you would cut onions before you open the restaurant, or when the restaurant isn't jam packed. Thank you.

ZloF8UceGryRcbePMTsXIQ.text: Great restaurant!!! The food was amazing! I highly recommend the lamb khutta! We will defiantly come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

V0q2QX-e7pWeW7rLb8fW0w.text: Great place for some very flavorful good. Very welcoming staff, nicely decorated. We ordered three starters - momo, fish and lamb, and some garlic naan.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Garlic naan
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish and lamb
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steamed chicken momo

7PJbEsePLtXGOb2AJO5rsw.text: Delicious and well worth a visit!   Do yourself a favor and order the mixed tandoori appetizer. You won't be disappointed.

BZz4c0VAIETG5dvtMpjf-g.text: We came to this place because it was well rated in Yelp and, when we saw the menu photos, the prices were fair. Upon getting seated we realized the menu photos were from 4 years ago, and now the prices increased about 25%... Oh well (I've posted the updated menu photos). We ordered a vegetarian main dish for 11, cheese naan bread for 4.25 and spiced poppadoms for 0.90. We were disappointed with the size of the dishes. For the price, the naan should have been twice as big. The mushroom dish, sold as a "main dish", was the size of starter dishes half their price in other Indian restaurants. At least it was tasty... The poppadoms were also very small, just two small cones. See photo. When we asked for the bill, we waited for what felt like 10 minutes and it didn't come. We reminded the waiter about it and it still didn't come. It took asking the manager to finally get it. Overall, while we thought the food was on the tasty side of average, the small size isn't worth what they charge, and service left to be desired.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The bill
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. For seeing the portion size
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. 2019 menu p2

BKtl1h19dp_cR6ntDY9imA.text: The best Indian food I've ever eaten! In a city full of great places to eat, Gurkha stood out. The food had a great sweet/spicy balance and was authentic. I'm looking forward to visiting again to experience the cuisine again.

QHJg7JFgTTtntaOza4syuQ.text: We passed by and found this restaurant  The food is pretty good and love my Curry mixed vegetable.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

5NwSmvwqgqZEqPIRDRCdkQ.text: We enjoyed a great meal here looking for something different than traditional Scottish fare. We were very happy with our dishes of fish tikka, the Gurkha chicken special, the saag paneer, and the mushroom and onion dish. The garlic naan was great!! The service was nice and their Nepalese draft beer was good. The only thing that could have been better was the slow service, but other than that we were very pleased!

rOPZzKdCZb7AeSxwq71m1g.text: I'm a huge fan of Indian food and had high hopes for Gurkha as the reviews seemed to be mostly positive...However, everything fell a bit short for me. My vegetable korma was NOT spicy at all even though I asked the waiter to note that I wanted it to be hot. He then gave me "hot" paste to add to my curry but it did not alter the spice level whatsoever, basically pointless to add.   The garlic naan portion was so sad...a kid could've eaten it all and it still wouldn't be enough. I forgot how much it was but for the price, you would think that the portion would be greater...very disappointed in the flavor too. It could've used way more garlic and cilantro. There was hardly anything on it and looked almost like a classic naan (with no garlic). My boyfriend liked his curry (forgot the name but it was Nepalese) and it had lamb in it. The curry itself I tasted and it was OK...too much meat flavor to my liking. He send the lamb itself was tender but game-y (kind of expected).   Bottom line: I wouldn't recommend coming here as there were other Indian restaurants in the area that seem better. I regret coming here for my last meal while visiting Edinburgh...If I ever visit Edinburgh again, I will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetable korma (NOT spicy at all, even though I asked for it to be spicy) huge disappointment. Naan portion was sad...too sma

v3yQZHdA-GBa5m_GHth5CQ.text: First timer (Edinburgh, Scotland).  This place is amazing!!! The fusion between Indian and Nepalese cuisine is very-very good. A group of four came here to eat and share the plates.   I had the Chicken:  Tikka Masala: 5 stars- very-very good, well seasoned, creamy, and spicy.  Garlic naan: 5 stars- OMG, the best one I have had up to date  Chai Masala Tea- 4 stars- I have had better  Two of my friends had lamb. One is a big chunk of meat on bone and for me it had a strong after taste (not good for me). The other was like a stew of small pieces of lamb and that one was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

4BQOLopFnDYDc8ZLBx0row.text: Outstanding food. High quality ingredients. Everything tasted fresh and the balance of spices in every dish we ordered was spot on. Favorite dish was the dal makhani- the lentils were so creamy and flavorful!  We were super impressed by the servers. They all shared the tables (not a huge place but not small either) and seemed to read each others' thoughts! Not only was the food out quick, but we were served by 4 different waiters and they were all on the same page with the progression of our meal. Literally the best service I've ever had. Worth a visit in Edinburgh!

khl6AMA7Ot-NPYhjTe0oeg.text: This was very good. We had a lamb curry and paneer sag. The tastes were good. Spicy enough for me. Not so spicy that my wife did not enjoy it. The pakora were ok. The NaN were good.  This may have been the most flavourful and enjoyable meal of our trip.  The restaurant was quieter (busy, but the people were less noisy) than most we were in, so it was very relaxing. The service was prompt and friendly without being intrusive.  But for so many choices, we would have gone back.  Would definitely recommend.

ooS1yyc5_4H9qzpmgydVMA.text: Really good Nepalese/ Indian restaurant in Edinburgh.  Ordered the poleko bhale kukhura which was very flavorful.  Equally good was the tandoori fish tikka and the mix vegetable curry.  Service was courteous and prices are fairly reasonable.  Would come back and recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

2hHDY-V-7w3WL_ItCspLWw.text: I went here by myself for a quick curry dinner after an evening of photography.   The lamb leg was fantastic. Rich curry that was just spicy enough.   Service was mediocre and they charged me for the pickles I ordered, but didn't receive. They also didn't apply the 15% discount from my Yelp checkin. I couldn't be bothered for the small benefit, but should have mentioned it.   I still highly recommend this place.

Bwji86sMFJ0Nj-EPXwFbZw.text: The food was delicious and the staff was great. I highly recommend this place I think it was one of our favorite meals in Scotland

YIUylFH1F5s4zaftUffHEQ.text: My friend and I were wandering around at 9:30 at night looking for food to eat. Many of the other restaurants' kitchens had closed, but thankfully, I stumbled upon this place and they let us in. The decor was very welcoming, homey, and comfortable. Feeling adventurous, we ordered several chicken dishes, the names of which we had some difficulty pronouncing, that were very well flavored. We thoroughly enjoyed the chef's secret blend of herbs and spices. It was tasty and impressive! The quality of the service was also noteworthy. The servers were courteous, kind, and attentive, so much so, I gave a 20% tip even though local customs don't require gratuity.  Highly recommended!

tFx75vaBMDkiAmDpPAdFuw.text: We made reservations based on comments and were very pleased with the food, service and hospitality!  Highly recommend Gurkha

D3eh4jKBycr1sDqDVp9Tjg.text: Had an excellent meal here. Lamb dishes were particularly tasty. Fish was fresh and grilled to perfection. Interesting decore.

MQBj-3LilMHA2-OcKc1NRQ.text: Perfect.... we are on Holiday from Northern California... would have never suspected that the best Indian food ( in our opinion) would be In Edinburgh:) Back home the Tikka Marsala is almost all cream and "crunchy" spices:((( and I believed it to be good...my husbands Lamb was delectable...amazing HEAT:) all together a wonderful experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

JHz3VfNYj-eSRMK6jFf_ww.text: The food here is fantastic! Definitely on the pricier side, but worth every pound! The chicken was delicious, perfectly marinated and prepared, and served up quite aesthetically pleasing. I went at a slower time of day, and although you might think that meant they had more time to serve me, the service was a bit slow. The food definitely made up for that, though. I would definitely recommend if you have a hankering for some spice or flavor in Edinburgh for the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

m7tW2-ipZUlzVQx5E_7ePw.text: I hate to bash a business, but I expected much better given the phenomenal reviews for this place between TripAdvisor & Yelp. The food was overpriced for the portion size with nothing particularly standing out as good. 7 GBP for a mixed pakora appetizer which consisted of only 2 pieces of vegetable & 2 pieces of chicken pakoras, both of which tasted very average. For some reason, the waiter tried to upsell us to purchase a 3rd dish when my friend and I had each already ordered a dish each, which was quite odd...I'm sure some tourists have fallen for it in the past. You pretty much pay for everything...there is an extra charge for rice and to order a butter naan is an extra 1 GPB over the price of a naan as it was surprisingly an off menu item when our check came. Overall, this was an unremarkable meal which I expected to be a treat considering the great reviews. As a side note, this business does not take American Express for payment while every other business I visited in Edinburgh the same day gladly took it. I would have given this business 2 & 1/2 stars as the service was friendly, but must round down considering how very overrated it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken tikka masala - much too sweet &amp; virtually no spice despite requesting it not to be mild.
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Interior of the restaurant towards the kitchen.
Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

0tWPlPKlEVExTGcmvIQuOQ.text: We came on Saturday night after being rejected from another Indian restaurant nearby and the place was surprisingly empty. After being seated, the waitress informed us it was tapas style, but we decided to start off with just a curry each and a couple of orders of rice between three of us. It was the right decision as that ended up being more than enough food. Considering the amount of food we inhaled, the price was definitely decent. I had the veggie korma, which was a little thin, but overall very tasty. My friends got the chicken curry and tikha masala. Again not the best, but still incredibly good. Will definitely return here, though I'd be interested to try some of the fusion foods next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gurkha Cafe & Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

4VV0rB5xyh0mXjRV758Ivg.text: Found this via Yelp and we loved it. Every dish was excellent. The service was excellent. Favorite dishes were the Piro Kukhura, Lamb Chola, and Bhot Ko Chelu.

5iHNxHOId1mJiZ1Fcc7NuQ.text: I am from Birmingham, so I know my curry. This place had it down, The decor was a little spartan but my food was top notch & I will be going back again, next time I am in Edinburgh.

MiJtDROG2nVwW8kA4UaOxg.text: Our group of 4 had one of the best meals here, and I think it's safe to say the best meal we had during our stay in Edinburgh. The staff were absolutely delightful and only added to the experience. This would be a regular place for me if I lived nearby!

GhqRHZ9RdSJYSO8mpOj33w.text: Simply awesome. Went there twice and the food was delicious and the service impeccable. Really busy in the evenings but worth the wait...this is how good restaurants should be like. The waitstaff was attentive and their suggestions was spot on.

-ioffD7XIuwhi9yA0PxdZQ.text: No complaints- friendly staff, unforgettable food. The flavours are so deep and intense! I love it! Go for the lunch deal- really good value. The first time round I got the Dal Makhani, which was DELICIOUS, and the second time I got the Rajma Aloo which was equally good. I wish I could go back but I don't know when I'll be in Edinburgh again :(

g9riPmPJVAE4x3ypP8ATkg.text: Generous portions. Lovely food, delicately seasoned. Service slowish. 2 starter + 2 main + 1 Btl wine 45

saLD_j14zzQNKORF3ZItgA.text: after wandering around the royal mile area, i decided to eschew pub food and try the Ghurkha Cafe instead. the food was very tasty, but certainly not worth the inflated price. ditto for the pint. i should have figured that prices would be high in this tourist trafficked area. aside from the price, the atmosphere was very nice, but the waitress was really pushing non-entrees on me, and was fairly dismissive when i didn't bite.

TZXEasVf4ndUrGJ80FG4Pg.text: trying to find a meal late at night, we ducked in here and got one of the best meals of our trip

zLLucT_sBPBazBobKNMU-Q.text: Having been to Gurkha Cafe a few times now I would definitely recommend it to anybody looking for a tasty, spicy meal. The menu is varied enough to suit most folk and the service has been great on every visit. The restaurant has a very relaxed atmosphere and is worth a visit either early on in the day or at night. The only problem was with the ventilation; your clothes really do smell like an Indian restaurant kitchen when you leave. But having said that, the food is so delicious you probably wont care all that much.
